post.Title: Java desktop links of the week, June 18
post.Content:
Hi all - just a quick post this week as I am overflowing with real work! Enjoy :-)

JavaFX

  • Michael Heinrichs has blogged about using the JavaFX AnimationTimer API (which is far more relevant to you than the name implies!).
  • Adam Bien has blogged about the enterprise side of JavaFX.
  • Eric Bruno has an article up explaining how to use the TableView control in JavaFX 2.
  • One of the big developments this week was the announcement of support for native packaging in the upcoming JavaFX 2.2. Following on from this, Richard Bair blogged about the plans for application deployment in JavaFX, including plans for application update support.
  • Gerrit Grunwald has blogged about the radial gauges in JFXtras Labs.
  • Carl Dea has released part four of his JavaFX 2 game tutorial.
  • The UGate blog has now got part two of the series on JavaFX programmatic POJO expression bindings.
  • Sai Pradeep Dandem has blogged about the Scroller control he has developed.

Catch you all next week!
